places.title: Rosehip Vegan Bistro
places.description: The meaning of “Rosehip” - not just local superfood berry, the wordplay hints on our style - pink and hip - modern and hipster atmosphere. In our restaurant we want to combine not only stylish interior, colorful food, good music, but also all the interesting people that work here and visit.

places.title: Holigans
places.description: Local, eco, vegetarian and vegan restaurant

places.title: Vegafe
places.description: We only offer a fresh-made meals from natural, non-processed and cruelty-free ingredients. We are following ayurvedic food preparation rules.

places.title: Ajurvedinė virtuvė
places.description: It's a health food restaurant. It offers a healthy vegetarian lunch made from fresh, organic products every day.

places.title: Casa la Familia
places.description: A vegetarian family pizzeria with Mediterranean flavors and daily lunch specials. Here, pizzas are baked in an authentic oven with burning firewood.

places.title: Grill London
places.description: Grill London is a chain of grill restaurants that visitors love because of its exceptional and responsible take on food quality. All of its steaks are grilled in unique ceramic grills using ecological fuels.

places.title: Meat Lovers Pub
places.description: Steakhouse and burgers

places.title: Ramenas ir pagaliukai
places.description: Japanese noodle Ramen bar

places.title: Wake Inn
places.description: Didžiausias pripučiamų vandens batutų parkų tinklas Lietuvoje WATER INN kviečia pramogauti ant vandens! Kliūčių ruožas, vandens batutai, laipynės, rungtynės su draugais ir nepamirštamos pramogos pasirinktame mieste! Kvieskite savo draugus, šeimos narius ar kolegas ir laisvalaikį praturtinkite nepamirštamomis pramogomis!

places.title: Čiuožimas ledu
places.description: Patirkite žiemos linksmybes su AKROPOLIO LEDU, kuris užtikrins maloniai šąlančias nosis ir geras emocijas visai šeimai!

places.title: Golfas
places.description: The V Golf Club, tai golfo klubas, įsikūręs nuostabios lietuviškos gamtos apsuptoje Vilnius Grand Resort teritorijoje, kuriame žaisti golfą bus iššūkis tiek pradedantiesiems, tiek pažengusiems.

places.title: Vichi vandens parkas
places.description: Čia vasara ir gera nuotaika niekada nesibaigia!

places.title: Exit Room
places.description: Hey smartypants, up for a challenge?

places.title: Insight Out
places.description: You may be smart, but how well can you think under pressure?

places.title: MO Museum
places.description: MO Museum is a modern art museum in Vilnius, Lithuania. The collection of 5,000 modern and contemporary pieces contains major Lithuanian artworks from the 1950s to this day.

places.title: House of Histories
places.description: The House of Histories is a space which invites visitors to experience history not as something fixed in the past but as integral to the reality we are creating today.

places.title: Gediminas Castle Tower
places.description: Gediminas Castle Tower is the most frequently visited branch of the National Museum of Lithuania. Its exhibition invites visitors to learn about the history of Vilnius as the centre of the Grand Duchy of Lithuania, and also to take in the most spectacular panoramic view of the city.

places.title: Bernardinai Garden
places.description: The Bernardinai Garden is a public park in the city of Vilnius, Lithuania. It is located on the right bank of the Vilnia River between the Gediminas Tower and Bernardine Monastery and covers over 9 hectares (22 acres). Most of its territory is parkland, divided in the monastery exposition, the botanic exposition and other recreational territory including a children's amusement park. It hosts a variety of festivals and exhibitions, including an amateur chess championship of Ostap Bender.

places.title: Vingis Park
places.description: Vingis Park is the largest park in Vilnius, Lithuania. Located in a curve of the Neris River, it covers 162 hectares (400 acres). A pedestrian bridge connects the park with Žvėrynas. It is used as a venue for various events, especially concerts and sports competitions. It contains a small botanical garden of Vilnius University, stadium, and an amphitheater.

places.title: Lukiškės Square
places.description: Lukiškės Square is the largest square (about 4 ha) in Vilnius, Lithuania, located in the center of the city. A major street in Vilnius, Gediminas Avenue, passes by the southern border of the square. It is surrounded by many public buildings, including Ministry of Finance, Ministry of Foreign affairs, Appeals Court, Academy of Music and Theater, Church of St. James and St. Phillip, Dominican Monastery with former St. Jacob Hospital. Currently the city of Vilnius holds a contest to redesign the square.

places.title: National Gallery of Art
places.description: NGA is composed of 10 collection exposition halls, a Grand Exhibition Hall, Auditorium, Information Centre, Museum Education Centre, storages, administration premises, bookshop and café.

places.title: Vilnius Picture Gallery
places.description: The gallery is located in the ornate and spacious Chodkevičiai Palace, which features impressive late Classicism interiors. The gallery's permanent exhibition provides a comprehensive introduction to the development of Lithuanian art from the 16th century to the beginning of the 20th century. The collection of work from the 18th and 19th centuries from the Vilnius Art School is of particular value. The gallery regularly hosts exhibitions, cultural evenings and classical music concerts.

places.title: The Republic of Užupis
places.description: Užupis is a neighborhood in Vilnius, the capital of Lithuania, largely located in Vilnius's old town,[1] a UNESCO World Heritage Site.In 1997, the residents of the area declared the Republic of Užupis, along with its own flag, unofficial currency, president, cabinet of ministers, a constitution written by Romas Lileikis and Tomas Čepaitis, an anthem, and an army of approximately 11 men.

places.title: Church of St. Anne
places.description: St. Anne's Church is a Roman Catholic church in Vilnius' Old Town, on the right bank of the Vilnia River established circa 1495-1500. It is a prominent example of both Flamboyant Gothic and Brick Gothic styles. St. Anne's is a prominent landmark in the Old Town of Vilnius that enabled the district to be included in the list of UNESCO World Heritage sites, and is one of the most interesting examples of Gothic architecture in Lithuania.
